sk.stuba.fiit.perconik.core.services

Interface Service

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Nameable, com.google.common.util.concurrent.Service
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ListenerService, ResourceService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractListenerService, AbstractResourceService

    public interface Service
extends Nameable, com.google.common.util.concurrent.Service
    An object with an operational state, plus asynchronous lifecycle methods to transition between states.

    Uniqueness of a service is determined by its qualified name. Two Service instances with the same qualified name should be implemented by the same class, provide the same functionality and behave the same way.

    Implementors of this interface are strongly encouraged to extend one of the abstract classes in this package which implement this interface and make the threading and state management easier.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Pavol Zbell
    See Also:
    Service

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        boolean equals(@Nullable
             java.lang.Object o)
        Compares the specified object with this service for equality. Returns true if the specified object is also service and the two services have the same name. This definition ensures that this method works properly across different implementations of the service interface.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - an object to be compared for equality with this service
        Returns:
        true if the specified object is equal to this service, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code value for this service. The hash code of a service should be equivalent to the hash code of the service's name.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the hash code value for this service
